This study forecast the future price of both oil and gas using the current trend through the usage of Monte 

Carlo Analysis, revenues gained from the petroleum project lifting activity, reevaluation of economic 

feasibility analysis by the method of Net Present Value (NPV), Internal Rate of Return (IRR), and 

sensitivity analysis to determine which parameters in the petroleum activity will be able to affect the 

projectÃ‚Â’s value the most. This parameters will then be analyzed to create a mitigation strategy that will be 

able to optimize the benefit of every corresponding parties. 

The results of reevaluation calculation in this research is $ 2,718,368,004 with WACC of 8.3%, as opposed 

to the expected value of $ 2,695,263,863. This is mainly due to the higher recovery rate of oil and gas price 

resulted from Monte Carlo method. Gas become the main factor that will drive the final value of the project 

due to the massive volume of production compared to the oil product. Gas price and gas OPEX become the 

two main factors that need to be mitigated to ensure the stability of the projectÃ‚Â’s value. Gas price fixing and 

gas OPEX efficiency become the two mitigation method that is eligible to be applied. Sliding scale split 

also become another alternative that can be pursued by the Government of Indonesia. Due to the fact that 

split revision is a zero sum game that will bring benefit to only one party, price fixing and OPEX efficiency 

become a much more recommended mitigation technique to be pursued.
